sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to union.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. Calculate (A × B) ∪ {5} and (B × {5}) ∪ A × {5}. Show that the two sets are not equal, hence proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to union.
